revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Cisco |model=Meraki MR34 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin=B00FA1TNZ2 |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=09/16/2013 |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf=Arcadyan |manuf_model=EAP1018FB-FLF-MK |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=managed access point |fcc_id=UDX-60025010 |ic_id=6961A-60025010 |us_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer=2.1 |pwr_barrel_inner=5 |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe=at |cpu1_brand=Freescale Semiconductor |cpu1_model=P1020 |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=32 |fla1_brand=Hynix |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |ram1=256 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num=2 |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=Broadcom BCM943460MC |wi1_module_if=Mini PCIe (oversized) |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM43460 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_module=Broadcom BCM943431MC |wi2_module_if=Mini PCIe |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM43431 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} [https://meraki.cisco.com/products/wireless/mr34 Product page] :[http://meraki.cisco.com/lib/pdf/meraki_datasheet_MR34.pdf Datasheet]
Per the FCC photos... *The ''Air Marshall'' radio is a BCM43428 (BCM43428KMLG, HT1137 P20, 160994 6 W;)
Per the info on ''Cisco Meraki'''s product page.. *PBGA SoC chip package *The device has two Mini PCIe wireless module. **One 3x3 bgn module BCM43431KMLG **One 3x3 ac+an module BCM43460KMLG *There is an on-board (dual-band, single-stream) 'security radio' (for [http://meraki.cisco.com/technologies/air-marshal-wips '''Air Marshall'''] functionality [rogue AP detection + mitigation, etc.]) - may handle spectrum analysis functionality as well <small>(maybe)</small> Per the datasheet.. *Beamforming is supported *For non-PoE power, barrel specs are 5 mm OD, 2.1 mm ID, center positive.. *Operation is possible w/ 802.3af PoE, with reduced functionality (max. 13.87 W 3af, max. 18 W 3at) *The dimensions of the device are [[Dimensions::253.4 mm x 155.8 mm x 37.1 mm]], not including the desk mount feet or mount plate. *The device weighs 25 oz / [[Weight::0.7 kg]].
Power adapters specified in the FCC test report are.. *''Powertron'' PA1015-2HU (100-240VAC ~ 50-60Hz, 0.4A -> 12VDC, 1.5A) *PoE: ''PowerDsine'' PD-9501G/AC (100-240VAC ~ 50-60Hz, 1.5A -> 55VDC, 1.35A)
